exercise.name: One Arm Medicine Ball Slam
exercise.whatItDoes: Powerful full-body explosive movement that builds core strength, shoulder power, and cardiovascular endurance while developing coordination and unilateral strength.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball in one hand.
Raise the ball overhead with both hands, then transfer it to one hand at the top.
Explosively slam the ball into the ground slightly in front of you using full body power from legs, core, and arm.
Catch the ball on the bounce with one hand (or pick it up) and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only the arm to slam instead of generating power from hips and legs.
Slamming the ball too far in front or behind, losing control.
Arching the lower back excessively during the overhead raise.

exercise.name: Navy Seal Burpee
exercise.whatItDoes: High-intensity full-body exercise combining burpee, push-ups, and jump that significantly improves cardiovascular endurance, strength, and muscular conditioning.

executionSteps.step: Start standing, then squat down and place hands on the ground.
Jump feet back into plank position and perform 3 push-ups.
Jump feet back toward hands, then explode upward into a jump while performing a tuck jump or high jump.
Land softly and immediately begin the next repetition.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing hips to sag during push-ups or plank phase.
Not achieving full range of motion in push-ups.
Landing stiff-legged on the jump, increasing impact on joints.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds lower body strength and muscle while improving balance, coordination, and core stability through unilateral leg work.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall holding dumbbells at sides or on shoulders.
Step forward with one leg into a lunge, lowering until back knee nearly touches the ground.
Push off the back leg and bring it forward into the next lunge step.
Continue alternating legs while walking forward in a straight line.

commonMistakes.mistake: Leaning too far forward or allowing front knee to pass toes.
Short steps that reduce range of motion.
Letting dumbbells pull shoulders forward, losing upright posture.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Push Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops explosive full-body power, shoulder strength, and core stability by combining leg drive with overhead pressing.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
Perform a slight quarter squat by bending knees.
Explosively extend legs and drive dumbbells overhead.
Lock out arms at the top, then lower dumbbells back to shoulders with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too much leg drive and turning it into a push jerk.
Leaning back excessively during the press.
Not fully locking out elbows at the top.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Deadlift
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets posterior chain (hamstrings, glutes, back) while building overall strength, grip, and postural stability.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet hip-width apart, dumbbells in front of thighs.
Hinge at hips, pushing butt back while keeping back straight.
Lower dumbbells toward ground, keeping them close to legs.
Drive through heels and extend hips to stand tall, squeezing glutes at the top.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rounding the back during the lowering phase.
Using arms to pull instead of driving with legs and hips.
Not achieving full hip extension at the top.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Sumo Deadlift
exercise.whatItDoes: Emphasizes inner thighs, glutes, and quads while building posterior chain strength with a wider stance variation.

executionSteps.step: Stand with wide stance, toes pointed out 45 degrees, holding dumbbell(s) between legs.
Hinge at hips and bend knees to grip the weight.
Keep chest up and back flat as you drive through heels to stand.
Squeeze glutes at the top, then lower with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rounding the back instead of keeping it neutral.
Knees caving inward during the lift.
Not pushing knees out in line with toes.

exercise.name: Backward Medicine Ball Throw
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops explosive full-body power, especially posterior chain and core, through triple extension and rotational force.

executionSteps.step: Stand with back to throwing area, holding medicine ball at chest.
Bend knees and hips slightly, then explosively extend and rotate to throw ball overhead backward.
Use full body power from legs through core to arms.

commonMistakes.mistake: Throwing primarily with arms instead of using leg and hip drive.
Releasing the ball too early or too late in the movement.

exercise.name: Zercher Carry
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds tremendous core strength, upper back, arms, and leg endurance while improving posture under heavy anterior load.

executionSteps.step: Deadlift barbell and cradle it in the crook of your elbows (Zercher position).
Stand tall with chest up and core braced.
Walk forward with controlled steps for prescribed distance or time.
Keep elbows high and maintain tight posture throughout.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting elbows drop, causing bar to slide down arms.
Leaning backward to counterbalance the load.
Rounding upper back or losing core brace.

exercise.name: Wall Walk
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops shoulder strength, core stability, and body control while building toward advanced movements like handstand push-ups.

executionSteps.step: Start in plank position facing away from wall, feet on wall.
Walk feet up the wall while simultaneously walking hands back toward wall.
Continue until chest is close to wall and body is nearly vertical.
Slowly reverse the movement back to starting position with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Arching lower back excessively instead of keeping core tight.
Rushing the movement and losing control.
Allowing shoulders to shrug up toward ears.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Hang Clean
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive full-body movement that develops hip power, shoulder stability, and coordination while building strength in the posterior chain and upper body.

executionSteps.step: Start with kettlebell hanging at mid-thigh level, feet hip-width apart.
Hinge at hips slightly, then explosively extend hips and knees to pull the kettlebell upward.
Shrug shoulders and pull elbow high to rack the kettlebell across forearm and biceps at chest level.
Absorb the catch softly by bending knees, then return to hang position.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with arms too early instead of using hip drive.
Banging the forearm with the kettlebell during the rack.
Leaning back or losing core tension during the catch.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Power Clean
exercise.whatItDoes: Full-body explosive lift that builds power, coordination, and strength across the posterior chain, traps, and shoulders.

executionSteps.step: Start with dumbbells on the floor just outside feet, hips back.
Explosively extend hips and knees, shrugging shoulders to pull dumbbells up.
Quickly drop under and catch dumbbells at shoulders in quarter squat position.
Stand tall, then lower dumbbells back to floor with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using arms to pull instead of generating power from hips.
Not achieving triple extension (ankles, knees, hips).
Landing with stiff legs instead of catching in quarter squat.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Devil Press
exercise.whatItDoes: High-intensity combination of burpee and dumbbell snatch that dramatically improves cardiovascular endurance, full-body strength, and power.

executionSteps.step: Start standing with dumbbells on ground between feet.
Squat down, place hands on dumbbells, jump feet back into plank.
Perform a push-up, then jump feet forward.
Explosively snatch or swing both dumbbells overhead in one motion and stand tall.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sagging hips during the push-up or plank phase.
Using momentum only from arms instead of full-body drive.
Not fully locking out overhead at the top.

exercise.name: Overhead Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Demands exceptional shoulder mobility, core strength, and lower body power while improving overall stability and coordination.

executionSteps.step: Snatch or press barbell overhead with wide grip, lock elbows.
Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Brace core and squat down as deep as mobility allows while keeping bar overhead.
Drive through heels to stand back up, maintaining active shoulders.

commonMistakes.mistake: Leaning forward or letting chest collapse.
Allowing elbows to bend or bar to drift forward.
Not reaching full depth due to poor mobility.

exercise.name: Ski Ergometer
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides intense full-body cardiovascular conditioning with emphasis on upper body pulling strength and endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing the machine, grab handles with palms down.
Drive powerfully with legs while pulling handles down in a diagonal motion.
Coordinate leg push and arm pull to mimic cross-country skiing.
Maintain rhythm and consistent power output.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling only with arms and neglecting leg drive.
Leaning too far forward or back, losing posture.
Inconsistent pacing leading to early fatigue.

exercise.name: Human Flag
exercise.whatItDoes: Extreme isometric hold requiring tremendous core, shoulder, and oblique strength to hold the body horizontally on a vertical pole.

executionSteps.step: Grip pole with both hands (bottom hand pull, top hand push).
Lift body sideways while pressing and pulling to lever into horizontal position.
Engage entire core and lats to maintain rigid body line parallel to ground.
Hold position, then lower with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sagging hips or bending at waist.
Not actively pushing and pulling simultaneously.
Lack of shoulder depression and scapular control.

exercise.name: Farmer's Walk
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds grip strength, core stability, leg endurance, and overall work capacity under heavy load.

executionSteps.step: Pick up heavy weights in each hand (dumbbells or kettlebells).
Stand tall, brace core, and keep shoulders back.
Walk forward with short, controlled steps for distance or time.

commonMistakes.mistake: Shuffling feet instead of proper walking stride.
Losing grip due to relaxed hands.

exercise.name: Log Lift
exercise.whatItDoes: Strongman overhead press variation that builds massive upper body and core strength with unstable, thick implement.

executionSteps.step: Clean the log from ground to chest (or start from rack).
Dip slightly at knees, then explosively press log overhead.
Lock out arms fully while stabilizing the awkward implement.
Lower log back to chest or ground with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pressing in front instead of driving upward close to face.
Leaning back excessively during the press.

exercise.name: Tire Sledge Hammer
exercise.whatItDoes: High-intensity full-body conditioning exercise that builds rotational power, grip strength, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing tire, holding sledgehammer with both hands.
Raise hammer overhead or to one side using core rotation.
Slam hammer forcefully into tire, alternating sides.
Maintain powerful swings with controlled follow-through.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only arms instead of full-body rotation.
Overhead swings without proper shoulder mobility.
Losing balance or footing during powerful swings.

exercise.name: Tire Flip
exercise.whatItDoes: Extreme full-body power exercise that builds explosive leg drive, grip, and posterior chain strength.

executionSteps.step: Squat down and grip underneath the tire, chest close.
Deadlift tire upward while driving knees into it.
At knee height, push forward aggressively to flip tire over.
Repeat continuously for distance or reps.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not driving knees forward to transition power.
Pushing too early before tire is vertical enough.

exercise.name: Barbell Snatch
exercise.whatItDoes: Highly technical Olympic lift that develops explosive full-body power, speed, coordination, and overhead stability.

executionSteps.step: Start with barbell on the floor, wide grip, feet hip-width apart.
Explosively extend hips and knees while shrugging to pull bar upward.
Rapidly drop under the bar into overhead squat position, catching with locked elbows.
Stand up fully to complete the lift.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with arms too early instead of using hip explosion.
Not achieving full triple extension before pulling under.
Pressing out the bar instead of locking elbows instantly.

exercise.name: Power Snatch
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive variation of the snatch that emphasizes power and speed with a higher catch position (no full squat).

executionSteps.step: Start with barbell on floor, wide snatch grip.
Explosively extend hips, knees, and ankles while pulling bar high.
Quickly drop into partial squat and catch bar overhead with locked arms.

commonMistakes.mistake: Catching too low instead of staying high in power position.
Banging the bar forward away from body.
Not fully extending hips at the top of the pull.

exercise.name: Muscle Snatch
exercise.whatItDoes: Strength-focused snatch variation that eliminates leg drive after the pull, emphasizing upper body pulling power and turnover speed.

executionSteps.step: Start with barbell on floor or hang position, wide grip.
Pull bar high using hips and strong shrug, keeping legs straight after initial extension.
Quickly turnover wrists and punch arms overhead without re-bending knees.
Lock out overhead and stand tall.

commonMistakes.mistake: Re-bending knees to catch (turning it into power snatch).
Slow elbow turnover at the top.
Looping the bar forward instead of keeping it close.

exercise.name: Heaving Snatch Balance
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops speed, confidence, and stability in the overhead squat receiving position for the snatch.

executionSteps.step: Start with bar on back rack, wide snatch grip.
Dip slightly at knees, then explosively drive upward while pushing body down under bar.
Catch in deep overhead squat with locked arms.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pressing the bar up instead of pulling yourself under.
Catching with bent elbows or unstable overhead position.
Leaning forward during the dip and drive.

exercise.name: Barbell Hang Clean
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive Olympic lift variation from hang position that builds power, posterior chain strength, and receiving stability.

executionSteps.step: Start with barbell at mid-thigh or knee hang, grip just outside shoulders.
Hinge slightly, then violently extend hips and shrug.
Pull elbows high and drop under bar to rack on shoulders in front squat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Arm pulling instead of hip explosion.
Banging elbows on thighs during rack.
Catching on toes or losing balance forward.

exercise.name: Rowing Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides low-impact, high-efficiency full-body cardiovascular conditioning with emphasis on posterior chain and endurance.

executionSteps.step: Sit on rower, strap feet in, grip handle with overhand grip.
Drive powerfully with legs first, then lean back slightly and pull arms to chest.
Reverse order for recovery: arms extend, body leans forward, knees bend.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with arms before driving with legs.
Rushing the recovery and losing rhythm.

exercise.name: Barbell Bent Over Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds upper back, lats, and posterior chain strength while improving posture and grip.

executionSteps.step: Hinge at hips with slight knee bend, grip barbell just outside knees.
Keep back flat and pull bar to lower chest or upper abdomen.
Squeeze shoulder blades together at top.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rounding the back during the pull.
Using momentum or standing up to cheat the weight.
Pulling bar too high toward upper chest.

exercise.name: Legless Rope Climb
exercise.whatItDoes: Extreme upper body pulling strength exercise that heavily targets lats, grip, and core while building tremendous pulling power.

executionSteps.step: Grip rope high overhead with both hands.
Pull body upward using arms and back while keeping legs straight and together.
Reach one hand higher and repeat pulling motion.
Descend with control using braking technique.

commonMistakes.mistake: Kipping or using legs to assist the climb.
Sliding down uncontrollably and burning hands.
Loss of grip due to poor hand positioning.

exercise.name: Push-up Toe Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines push-up with dynamic core engagement to build chest, shoulder, triceps strength and improve coordination.

executionSteps.step: At the top, lift one hand and opposite foot to touch hand to toe.
Return to plank and repeat alternating sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sagging hips during the toe touch.

exercise.name: Bent Over Dumbbell Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets upper back, lats, and rear shoulders while improving posture and unilateral strength.

executionSteps.step: Hinge at hips with slight knee bend, holding dumbbells hanging down.
Pull dumbbells toward hips, squeezing shoulder blades.
Keep elbows close to body during the pull.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rounding the back or standing too upright.
Pulling too high toward chest instead of hips.

exercise.name: Muscle-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced gymnastic movement combining explosive pull-up with dip to transition over bar or rings, building immense upper body strength.

executionSteps.step: Hang from rings or bar with false grip (on rings).
Explosively pull chest high while transitioning elbows over.
Roll forward and press out into dip position.
Complete full dip to lockout overhead.

commonMistakes.mistake: Lack of false grip leading to failed transition.
Not pulling high enough before transitioning.

exercise.name: Push Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines leg drive with overhead press to build explosive power and shoulder strength.

executionSteps.step: Rack barbell at shoulders, elbows forward.
Dip slightly at knees while keeping torso upright.
Explosively drive through legs to press bar overhead.
Lock out arms and stand tall.

commonMistakes.mistake: Turning movement into jerk by re-dipping.

exercise.name: Landmine Squat to Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines front squat with unilateral press to build lower body strength, core stability, and pressing power.

executionSteps.step: Hold landmine bar at chest height, feet shoulder-width.
Squat down until thighs are parallel or below.
Drive up explosively and press bar forward/upward.
Lock out at top, then lower bar and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Leaning too far forward during squat.
Losing core brace and arching back.

exercise.name: Barbell Clean and Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Classic compound movement combining clean with strict or push press to build total-body strength and power.

executionSteps.step: Perform full clean to rack bar at shoulders.
Immediately press or push press bar overhead.
Lower bar to floor with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Poor clean technique leading to bad rack position.
Using strict press when form breaks down.

exercise.name: Power Clean
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive Olympic lift that develops full-body power, speed, and coordination with high catch position.

executionSteps.step: Start with bar on floor, grip just outside legs.
Explosively extend hips and shrug to pull bar high.
Drop into partial squat and catch bar on shoulders.

commonMistakes.mistake: Arm pulling instead of hip drive.
Catching too low instead of power position.
Bar crashing on shoulders due to poor rack.

exercise.name: Turkish Get-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Complex full-body movement that builds shoulder stability, core strength, mobility, and coordination through multiple planes.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back holding weight overhead with one straight arm.
Roll to opposite elbow, then hand, while keeping arm locked.
Drive hips high into bridge, sweep leg under to kneeling position.
Stand up fully, then reverse steps back to ground.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting loaded arm bend or waver overhead.
Collapsing core during bridge or lunge phase.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Swings
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive hip hinge that builds posterior chain power, cardiovascular endurance, and grip strength.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulders, kettlebell in front.
Hinge at hips to grab handle with both hands, shoulders back.
Hike bell back between legs, then explosively drive hips forward.
Swing bell to chest height using hip snap, then control descent.

commonMistakes.mistake: Squatting instead of hinging at hips.
Using arms to lift instead of hip power.
Overextending or leaning back at top.

exercise.name: One Arm Kettlebell Snatch
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral explosive lift that develops full-body power, shoulder stability, and cardiovascular conditioning.

executionSteps.step: Start with kettlebell on ground between feet.
Hinge and explosively pull bell upward with one arm.
Punch hand through to lock overhead in one fluid motion.
Lower bell safely to ground or back swing.

commonMistakes.mistake: Banging forearm with bell during lockout.
Pressing out instead of punching through.

exercise.name: Impossible Dips
exercise.whatItDoes: Extreme ring dip variation requiring immense pressing strength and core control in inverted position.

executionSteps.step: Start in support hold on rings.
Lower slowly while leaning forward until rings reach hips.
Press back up powerfully to support.

commonMistakes.mistake: Losing false grip or ring control.

exercise.name: Korean Dips
exercise.whatItDoes: Deep ring dip variation with extreme forward lean that heavily targets chest, shoulders, and core.

executionSteps.step: Start in support, lean torso far forward.
Lower until shoulders drop well below elbows/hands.
Press back up while maintaining forward angle.

exercise.name: Straight Bar Dip
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced dip variation on single straight bar that demands high triceps, chest, and core strength.

executionSteps.step: Grip bar with both hands close together, body in front.
Lean slightly forward and lower chest toward bar.
Press powerfully back to locked arms.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Clean and Jerk
exercise.whatItDoes: Classic Olympic-style lift with kettlebell that builds explosive power, shoulder endurance, and full-body coordination.

executionSteps.step: Clean kettlebell to rack position explosively.
Dip slightly and drive upward to jerk overhead.
Catch in split or squat stance with locked arm.

commonMistakes.mistake: Poor rack position causing forearm bang.
Unstable catch or early arm bend.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Burpees
exercise.whatItDoes: High-intensity burpee variation with dumbbells that adds upper body and grip challenge while boosting metabolism.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbells at sides, squat and place on ground.
Jump feet back into plank, perform push-up.
Jump feet forward, then clean dumbbells to shoulders.

commonMistakes.mistake: Dropping dumbbells instead of controlled lower.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Jump Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Plyometric squat variation that develops explosive lower body power and cardiovascular conditioning.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbells at sides or shoulders.
Squat down to parallel or below.
Explosively jump upward as high as possible.
Land softly and immediately descend into next rep.

commonMistakes.mistake: Leaning too far forward or rounding back.

exercise.name: Burpees
exercise.whatItDoes: Ultimate bodyweight conditioning exercise combining squat, push-up, and jump for maximum calorie burn and endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall, then squat and place hands on ground.
Jump feet back into plank, perform push-up.
Jump feet forward, then explode upward into jump.
Land softly and immediately begin next rep.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sagging or arching back in plank.
Incomplete push-up or no chest to ground.

exercise.name: L-Sit Pull-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines L-sit hold with pull-up to massively challenge core compression and pulling strength.

executionSteps.step: Hang from bar and raise straight legs to L-position.
Maintain L-hold while performing strict pull-up.
Lower slowly while keeping legs up.

commonMistakes.mistake: Bending knees or piking hips to cheat L.

exercise.name: Back Lever
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced isometric hold that builds tremendous shoulder, back, and core strength in horizontal supinated position.

executionSteps.step: Start in inverted hang, supinated grip.
Depress shoulders and pull body into horizontal line.
Keep arms straight and body rigid parallel to ground.
Hold position, then return with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Arching back instead of hollow body.

exercise.name: Front Lever Pull-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Extreme advanced pull-up performed while maintaining front lever position, building massive lat, core, and shoulder strength.

executionSteps.step: Hold full front lever (body horizontal, facing up).
Pull chest toward bar while keeping body rigid and horizontal.
Lower slowly back to front lever hold.

commonMistakes.mistake: Dropping hips or bending at waist.
Bending arms too early without full lever control.

exercise.name: One Arm Dumbbell Snatch
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral explosive lift that develops full-body power, coordination, and unilateral shoulder stability.

executionSteps.step: Start with dumbbell on ground between feet.
Hinge and explosively pull with one arm, shrugging shoulder.
Punch hand upward to lock dumbbell overhead.
Lower with control or drop safely.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pressing out instead of fast punch-through.
Poor hip drive, relying only on arm.

exercise.name: Archer Pull-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral pulling progression toward one-arm pull-up that heavily loads one side while building lat and bicep strength.

executionSteps.step: Grip bar wide, start from dead hang.
Pull body toward one straight arm while bending the working arm.
Lower slowly with control on working side.

exercise.name: Cross Body Push-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Plyometric push-up variation that adds rotational power and oblique engagement for enhanced core and chest development.

executionSteps.step: Lower chest, then explosively push up.
At top, drive one knee across body toward opposite elbow.
Land hands and repeat alternating sides.

exercise.name: Trap Bar Jump Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Loaded explosive squat that maximizes lower body power output and vertical jump capability.

executionSteps.step: Stand inside trap bar, grip handles, feet shoulder-width.
Explosively extend hips and jump as high as possible.
Land softly and reset for next rep.

exercise.name: Medicine Ball Sit-up Throw
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive core exercise that builds abdominal power and coordination through dynamic throwing motion.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back holding medicine ball at chest, partner or wall opposite.
At top, throw ball forcefully forward.
Catch return and lower with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using arms only to throw instead of hip snap.

exercise.name: Barbell Jump Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Loaded plyometric squat that dramatically increases lower body explosive power.

executionSteps.step: Rack light barbell on back, feet shoulder-width.
Explosively jump upward driving through heels.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too heavy weight limiting explosion.
Bar bouncing on back at bottom.

exercise.name: Handstand Walk
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced gymnastic skill that builds shoulder strength, core control, and balance while moving in handstand.

executionSteps.step: Kick up into freestanding or wall-assisted handstand.
Shift weight slightly to one hand, move opposite hand forward.
Maintain tight core and pointed toes.

exercise.name: Handstand
exercise.whatItDoes: Isometric hold that develops exceptional shoulder strength, core stability, and balance control.

executionSteps.step: Kick up into handstand against wall or freestanding.
Stack shoulders, hips, and feet vertically.
Engage core, point toes, and squeeze glutes.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Clean and Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Compound movement combining clean with strict press to build full-body strength and shoulder development.

executionSteps.step: Brace core and press kettlebell strictly overhead.
Lower to rack, then back to ground.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using leg drive during press (turning into push press).
Poor rack position causing wrist strain.

exercise.name: Climbing Monkey Bars
exercise.whatItDoes: Functional pulling and grip exercise that builds upper body strength, coordination, and endurance.

executionSteps.step: Grip first bar, hang with straight arms.
Swing or pull forward to reach next bar.
Alternate hands to progress across bars.

commonMistakes.mistake: Bending arms too early reducing distance.
Dropping suddenly instead of controlled dismount.

exercise.name: Kipping Handstand Push-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Kipping variation allowing higher volume handstand push-ups to build shoulder endurance and gymnastic capacity.

executionSteps.step: Create kip by arching then hollowing body.
Use momentum to press head through full range.

exercise.name: Snap Jumps
exercise.whatItDoes: High-intensity variation of mountain climbers that elevates heart rate and improves lower body explosiveness.

executionSteps.step: Explosively drive both knees toward chest simultaneously.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sagging hips or piking butt up.

exercise.name: Barbell Thruster
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines front squat with overhead press in one fluid motion to build explosive power, leg strength, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Hold barbell at shoulders, elbows high.
Squat down until thighs are parallel.
Drive explosively upward and press bar overhead.
Lock out arms at top, then lower bar to shoulders and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pressing bar before full hip extension.
Allowing elbows to drop during squat.

exercise.name: Bodyweight Skull Crushers
exercise.whatItDoes: Bodyweight triceps isolation exercise that builds arm strength and shoulder stability using horizontal bar.

executionSteps.step: Grip bar shoulder-width, body angled backward.
Bend elbows to lower forehead toward bar.
Extend elbows to push body away from bar.
Keep body straight and core tight throughout.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sagging hips or bending at waist.

exercise.name: Straddle Planche
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced isometric hold that demands extreme shoulder, chest, and core strength with legs straddled for easier balance.

executionSteps.step: Lean forward on hands, protract shoulders.
Lift feet off ground, straddle legs wide.
Keep hips at shoulder height, body parallel to floor.
Hold with straight arms and hollow body.

exercise.name: One Arm Kettlebell Swing
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral hip hinge that builds posterior chain power, core stability, and grip strength.

executionSteps.step: Hold kettlebell in one hand, hinge at hips.
Explosively drive hips forward to swing to chest height.
Switch hands at top or bottom, repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using arm instead of hip snap.

exercise.name: Medicine Ball Overhead Slam
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive full-body power movement that releases stress while building core, shoulder, and hip strength.

executionSteps.step: Hold medicine ball overhead with both hands.
Rise onto toes, then slam ball powerfully into ground.
Use full hip extension and core rotation.
Catch bounce or pick up and repeat.

exercise.name: Wall Ball
exercise.whatItDoes: High-rep metabolic exercise combining squat and overhead throw to target mark for maximum calorie burn.

executionSteps.step: Hold medicine ball at chest, face wall target.
Explosively stand and throw ball to target height.
Catch ball and immediately descend into next squat.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Renegade Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Anti-rotation core exercise that builds back strength, grip, and plank stability.

executionSteps.step: Row one kettlebell to hip while keeping hips square.
Keep body in straight line, no twisting.

commonMistakes.mistake: Jerking weight instead of controlled pull.

exercise.name: Push-Up to Renegade Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines push-up with alternating dumbbell rows for total upper body and core strength.

executionSteps.step: At top, row one dumbbell to hip.
Row opposite side, then repeat sequence.

exercise.name: Modified Hindu Push-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Flowing push-up variation that improves shoulder mobility, chest strength, and core control.

executionSteps.step: Dive chest forward into upward dog.
Push hips back to downward dog.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sagging lower back in upward dog.
Not fully extending hips in downward dog.

exercise.name: Planche Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Extreme pushing exercise performed in planche position, building incredible shoulder and core strength.

executionSteps.step: Hold planche lean or full planche.
Bend elbows to lower chest toward hands.
Press powerfully back to starting position.
Keep body parallel to ground throughout.

commonMistakes.mistake: Bending at hips instead of elbows.

exercise.name: Archer Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral push-up progression toward one-arm push-up that heavily loads one side at a time.

executionSteps.step: Lower chest toward one hand while keeping opposite arm straight.
Push back up through working arm.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Figure 8
exercise.whatItDoes: Dynamic core and coordination drill that improves hip mobility and oblique strength.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet wider than shoulders, slight squat.
Pass kettlebell between legs in figure-8 pattern.
Hand to hand behind each leg smoothly.
Keep torso upright and movement fluid.

commonMistakes.mistake: Standing too upright, reducing core work.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Renegade Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Anti-rotation plank row that builds back strength, core stability, and shoulder endurance.

executionSteps.step: Row one dumbbell to hip while resisting rotation.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Iron Cross
exercise.whatItDoes: Gymnastic-inspired shoulder exercise that builds extreme deltoid and rotator cuff strength.

executionSteps.step: Raise arms laterally to form cross position.
Hold isometric with arms parallel to floor.

exercise.name: Ring Dips
exercise.whatItDoes: Unstable dip variation that massively strengthens chest, triceps, and shoulders while improving joint stability.

executionSteps.step: Start in support hold on rings, turned out slightly.
Press back to support, keeping rings close.
Maintain false grip for easier transition.

exercise.name: Battle Rope
exercise.whatItDoes: Intense conditioning tool that builds shoulder endurance, grip strength, and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Hold rope ends, slight squat stance.
Alternately whip ropes to create waves.
Maintain fast, continuous motion for time.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only arms instead of full body.
Small, weak waves due to low power.

exercise.name: Weighted Lateral Neck Flexion
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens the lateral neck muscles (sternocleidomastoid and scalenes) to improve neck stability and thickness.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your side on a bench, head hanging off the edge.
Hold a light weight plate against the side of your head.
Slowly lower head toward shoulder, then flex laterally to raise it back up.
Perform reps on one side, then switch.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too heavy weight causing jerking.
Rotating head instead of pure lateral flexion.

exercise.name: Weighted Lying Neck Extension
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the posterior neck muscles (splenius, trapezius upper fibers) for improved posture and rear neck development.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on bench, head off edge.
Place weight plate on back of head.
Lower head slowly, then extend neck to raise head upward.

exercise.name: Weighted Lying Neck Flexion
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens anterior neck muscles to balance posterior chain and improve neck resilience.

executionSteps.step: Lie face up on bench, head off edge.
Lower head backward slowly, then flex neck to raise head.

exercise.name: Gittleson Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates upper trapezius and levator scapulae for enhanced neck and trap development.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench holding dumbbells at sides.
Hold peak contraction, then lower slowly.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rolling shoulders instead of straight shrug.

exercise.name: Diagonal Neck Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches upper trapezius and scalenes to relieve tension and improve neck mobility.

executionSteps.step: Tilt head diagonally forward toward one shoulder.
Gently pull with opposite hand for deeper stretch.

exercise.name: Neck Rotation Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves rotational mobility of cervical spine and relieves rotational tension.

executionSteps.step: Sit or stand with good posture.
Turn head slowly to one side until stretch felt.

commonMistakes.mistake: Leading with chin instead of whole head.

exercise.name: Neck Flexion Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches posterior neck muscles to counteract forward head posture.

executionSteps.step: Apply light pressure with hands if needed.

exercise.name: Neck Extension Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches anterior neck muscles to improve posture and reduce tightness.

executionSteps.step: Sit or stand with good posture.
Hold gentle stretch at end range.

exercise.name: Side Neck Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets lateral neck muscles to relieve side tension and improve range of motion.

executionSteps.step: Use hand for gentle overpressure if desired.

exercise.name: Side Push Neck Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Active stretch using resistance to improve lateral neck strength and flexibility.

executionSteps.step: Place hand on side of head.
Push head into hand isometrically for 5-10 seconds.
Relax and tilt head away for deeper stretch.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too much force causing strain.

exercise.name: Front and Back Neck Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Alternates flexion and extension stretch to balance anterior and posterior neck muscles.

executionSteps.step: Tuck chin to chest for flexion stretch, hold.
Tilt head back gently for extension stretch, hold.

exercise.name: Chin Tuck
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens deep neck flexors and corrects forward head posture.

executionSteps.step: Sit or stand with good posture.
Draw chin straight back (double chin motion).

commonMistakes.mistake: Tucking chin downward instead of straight back.

exercise.name: Prone Cervical Extension
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens posterior neck extensors without equipment for better posture support.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down, arms at sides.
Lift head and chest slightly off ground.
Keep gaze down to avoid hyperextension.

exercise.name: Kneeling Neck Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Deep stretch for posterior neck and upper back in kneeling position.

executionSteps.step: Kneel on floor, sit back on heels.
Gently pull head downward toward chest.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rounding entire back instead of isolating neck.

exercise.name: Weighted Neck Harness Extension
exercise.whatItDoes: Heavy loaded extension using harness to significantly develop posterior neck muscles.

executionSteps.step: Sit or stand wearing neck harness with weight attached.

exercise.name: Lying Weighted Neck Flexion
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets anterior neck flexors with added resistance to build strength and muscle in the front of the neck.

executionSteps.step: Lie face up on bench, head off edge.
Lower head backward controlled, then flex neck to lift head up.
Repeat for reps with slow tempo.

exercise.name: Lying Weighted Neck Extension
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens posterior neck extensors with resistance to enhance rear neck development and posture.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on bench, head off edge.
Place weight plate on back of head.
Lower head down, then extend neck to raise head.

exercise.name: Lever Neck Right Side Flexion (plate loaded)
exercise.whatItDoes: Machine-based lateral flexion to isolate and strengthen right side neck muscles with progressive loading.

executionSteps.step: Sit in lever machine, pad on right side of head.
Return slowly, repeat, then switch sides.

exercise.name: Lever Neck Extension (plate loaded)
exercise.whatItDoes: Plate-loaded machine extension to build posterior neck strength safely.

executionSteps.step: Sit facing into machine, pad on back of head.

exercise.name: Cable Seated Neck Flexion with head harness
exercise.whatItDoes: Cable resistance flexion using harness to target anterior neck for controlled development.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench, harness on head attached to low cable.

exercise.name: Cable Seated Neck Extension with head harness
exercise.whatItDoes: Posterior neck extension with cable and harness for progressive overload.

executionSteps.step: Sit facing away from low cable, harness attached.

exercise.name: Sphinx Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Gentle prone stretch opening anterior neck and chest while strengthening lower back.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down, forearms on ground.
Lift chest upward, elbows under shoulders.

exercise.name: Floor Hyperextension
exercise.whatItDoes: Bodyweight extension strengthening posterior chain including neck extensors.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down, hands behind head.
Lift chest and head off floor.
Extend neck in line with spine.

exercise.name: Bhujangasana | Cobra Abdominal Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Yoga pose stretching anterior neck and abdomen while gently strengthening back.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down, palms under shoulders.
Press into hands to lift chest.

exercise.name: Fish Pose
exercise.whatItDoes: Opens chest and throat, stretching anterior neck deeply in supported backbend.

executionSteps.step: Lift chest, place crown of head on floor.
Arch back, hands under hips or clasped.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not supporting with forearms if needed.

exercise.name: Superman
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens entire posterior chain including neck extensors for better posture.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down, arms extended forward.
Lift arms, chest, and legs off ground.

exercise.name: Overhead Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets upper trapezius and improves overhead shoulder stability by shrugging with arms locked overhead.

executionSteps.step: Press barbell or dumbbells overhead, lock elbows.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too heavy weight compromising lockout.
Rolling shoulders instead of straight elevation.

exercise.name: Gittleson Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates upper traps by eliminating momentum through seated forward lean position.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench, lean torso forward, head down.
Shrug shoulders straight up toward ears.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sitting upright instead of leaning forward.
Using legs or back to assist.

exercise.name: 45 Degree Incline Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets upper back and middle/lower traps with supported chest position to reduce cheating.

executionSteps.step: Lie chest down on 45-degree incline bench.
Pull elbows back, squeezing shoulder blades.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Classic trap builder focusing on upper trapezius elevation.

executionSteps.step: Shrug shoulders upward as high as possible.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too light weight with no stretch.

exercise.name: Cable Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides constant tension on traps throughout range for enhanced growth.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing low cable pulley, grip handles.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with arms instead of shrugging.

exercise.name: Barbell Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Heavy compound shrug for maximum upper trap development and thickness.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding barbell with overhand grip.

exercise.name: Behind The Back Barbell Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Variation that shifts emphasis to middle/lower traps and reduces upper trap dominance.

executionSteps.step: Hold barbell behind back with overhand grip.
Shrug shoulders upward and slightly back.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Incline Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Prone shrug on incline bench to isolate lower traps and reduce momentum.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on incline bench, dumbbells hanging.

exercise.name: Prone Incline Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets lower traps with prone position and stretch emphasis.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on incline or decline bench.
Hold dumbbells, let shoulders stretch down.

exercise.name: Lever Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Machine-based shrug for controlled progressive overload on traps.

executionSteps.step: Sit or stand in lever shrug machine.

exercise.name: Rear Delt Fly Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates rear delts and upper/middle traps with supported movement.

executionSteps.step: Sit facing into rear delt machine, chest supported.
Pull arms back in arc, squeezing rear shoulders.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling too high with traps dominating.

exercise.name: Lever Gripless Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Gripless variation reduces forearm involvement to focus purely on trap elevation.

executionSteps.step: Stand in gripless shrug machine, pads on shoulders.

exercise.name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
exercise.whatItDoes: Constant tension isolation for rear delts and upper traps.

executionSteps.step: Stand between cables, cross arms to grip opposite handles.
Pull arms out and back in wide arc.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with elbows too high (trap dominant).

exercise.name: Bent Over Lateral Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates rear delts and middle traps in hinged position.

executionSteps.step: Bend at hips, torso near parallel, dumbbells hanging.
Raise arms out to sides until parallel.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with traps instead of rear delts.

exercise.name: Cable Upright Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets upper traps and delts with constant cable tension.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing low cable, grip close on bar or rope.
Pull upward to chin height, elbows high.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling too high risking shoulder impingement.
Narrow grip causing internal rotation issues.

exercise.name: Face Pull
exercise.whatItDoes: Excellent for rear delts, middle traps, and rotator cuff health while improving posture.

executionSteps.step: Set cable at face height, use rope attachment.
Pull rope toward face, elbows high.
Externally rotate hands at end, squeeze rear shoulders.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling to chest instead of face.
Using too much weight and momentum.

exercise.name: Half Kneeling High Cable Row Rope
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets upper back, rear delts, and middle/lower traps with unilateral stability and constant tension.

executionSteps.step: Kneel half-kneeling facing high cable, rope in both hands.
Pull rope toward face, elbows high and wide.
Squeeze shoulder blades together at end.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Simple lateral raise variation that also engages upper traps during shoulder elevation.

executionSteps.step: Raise arms laterally to shoulder height.

commonMistakes.mistake: Shrugging too high instead of side raise.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Upright Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds upper traps and delts with dumbbell variation for better range and grip.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbells close together in front.
Pull elbows high and wide toward chin.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with wrists or hands first.

exercise.name: Bodyweight Military Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced bodyweight press targeting shoulders and upper traps with isometric hold.

executionSteps.step: Bend elbows to lower head toward ground.

exercise.name: Kneeling High Pulley Row
exercise.whatItDoes: High pulley row targeting upper back, traps, and rear delts with kneeling stability.

executionSteps.step: Kneel facing high pulley, grip rope or bar.
Pull toward upper chest, elbows high.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling to stomach instead of chest.

exercise.name: Ez Bar Upright Row
exercise.whatItDoes: EZ bar variation reduces wrist strain while building upper traps and delts.

executionSteps.step: Hold EZ bar with close grip.
Pull elbows high to chin level.

exercise.name: Band Pull-Apart
exercise.whatItDoes: Excellent for rear delts, rhomboids, and middle traps to improve posture and shoulder health.

executionSteps.step: Hold band at shoulder width, arms straight forward.
Pull band apart by squeezing shoulder blades.
Bring hands to sides at face level.

commonMistakes.mistake: Leading with elbows instead of scapulae.
Using too light band with no tension.

exercise.name: Bent Over Reverse Cable Fly
exercise.whatItDoes: Constant tension rear delt and trap isolation in bent-over position.

executionSteps.step: Bend at hips facing low cables, cross arms to grip opposite handles.
Pull arms out and back in wide arc.

exercise.name: Bent-Over Barbell Reverse Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Heavy reverse fly variation targeting rear delts and middle/lower traps.

executionSteps.step: Bend at hips, hold barbell with wide overhand grip.
Raise barbell out and up in arc to parallel.

exercise.name: Barbell Rear Delt Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Barbell variation of reverse raise for heavier loading on rear delts and traps.

executionSteps.step: Bend over, hold barbell with wide grip.
Raise arms back and out to parallel.

exercise.name: Smith Machine Shrug
exercise.whatItDoes: Fixed-path shrug for heavy trap loading with safety and control.

executionSteps.step: Stand in Smith machine, bar at thighs.

exercise.name: Incline Dumbbell Reverse Fly
exercise.whatItDoes: Supported reverse fly targeting rear delts and middle/lower traps.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on incline bench.
Raise arms out and back, squeezing rear shoulders.

exercise.name: Incline Dumbbell Y-Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets lower traps and rear delts with Y-arm path on incline bench.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on incline bench, dumbbells hanging.
Raise arms forward and out in Y shape.
Squeeze lower traps and rear delts.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Incline T-Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates middle and lower traps with T-arm path on incline bench.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on incline bench.
Raise arms straight out to sides (T shape).

exercise.name: Swimming
exercise.whatItDoes: Prone swimming motion strengthens rear delts, traps, and upper back with bodyweight.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down, arms extended forward.
Lift chest, alternate arm pulls backward.

exercise.name: Bent Over Rear Delt Fly | Gymstick
exercise.whatItDoes: Resistance stick variation of rear fly for rear delts and traps.

executionSteps.step: Bend at hips, hold Gymstick in front.
Pull ends apart and back in arc.

exercise.name: Scapular Protraction and Retraction
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates scapular movement to strengthen middle/lower traps and improve posture.

exercise.name: Cross Cable Face Pull
exercise.whatItDoes: Cross-cable variation of face pull that enhances rear delt, middle/lower trap, and external rotator activation.

executionSteps.step: Set cables high, cross arms to grip opposite handles.
Pull ropes toward face, elbows high and wide.
Externally rotate at end, squeeze shoulder blades.

exercise.name: Elbow Reverse Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Reverse push-up variation emphasizing lower traps and scapular depression.

executionSteps.step: Start in reverse plank (hands behind, fingers forward).
Lower hips toward ground by bending elbows.

exercise.name: Scapula Dips
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates lower traps and serratus through scapular depression in dip position.

executionSteps.step: Support on parallel bars, arms locked.
Depress shoulders downward without bending elbows.

exercise.name: Push-Up Plus
exercise.whatItDoes: Push-up variation with protraction at top to strengthen serratus and lower traps.

executionSteps.step: At top (arms locked), protract shoulder blades (push chest away).

exercise.name: Seated Ballerina Exercise
exercise.whatItDoes: Seated stretch and activation for upper traps and neck to improve mobility.

executionSteps.step: Sit tall, arms overhead in ballerina pose.

exercise.name: Seated Scapular Retraction Exercise
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates middle traps and rhomboids for posture correction.

exercise.name: Foam Roller Rhomboids
exercise.whatItDoes: Self-myofascial release for rhomboids and middle traps to reduce tightness.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, foam roller under mid-back.

exercise.name: Foam Roller Upper Back
exercise.whatItDoes: Releases upper back and trap tightness for improved posture and mobility.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, roller under upper traps.
Roll slowly from upper traps to mid-back.

exercise.name: Scapula Pull-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates lower traps through scapular depression in hanging position.

executionSteps.step: Hang from bar with straight arms.
Depress shoulders downward without bending elbows.
Pull shoulder blades down and back.

exercise.name: Serratus Wall Slide With Foam Roller
exercise.whatItDoes: Activates serratus and lower traps while improving shoulder mobility.

executionSteps.step: Hold foam roller against wall at shoulder height.
Slide roller upward while protracting shoulders.

exercise.name: Dip Shrugs (Serratus Shrugs)
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates lower traps and serratus through depression and elevation in dip support.

executionSteps.step: Depress shoulders down, then shrug up.

exercise.name: Wide Grip Barbell Bent Over Row Plus
exercise.whatItDoes: Wide row with extra scapular retraction at top for enhanced middle/upper trap activation.

executionSteps.step: Bend over holding wide grip barbell.

exercise.name: Wide Grip Alternate Barbell Bent Over Row Plus
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral wide row variation with extra retraction for balanced trap development.

executionSteps.step: Bend over with wide grip barbell.
Row with one side dominant, extra squeeze.

exercise.name: One-Arm Dumbbell Upright Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral upright row to correct imbalances in traps and delts.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using wrist instead of elbow lead.

exercise.name: Cable Y Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Cable version of Y-raise targeting lower traps and rear delts with constant tension.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing low cables, grip handles.
Raise arms forward and up in Y shape.

exercise.name: Barbell Upright Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets upper trapezius and lateral deltoids for shoulder and trap development.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding barbell with narrow overhand grip.
Pull bar upward to chin height, leading with elbows.

exercise.name: Resistance Band Bent Over Rear Delt Fly
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates rear delts and middle traps with constant band tension in hinged position.

executionSteps.step: Step on band, hinge at hips, hold ends.
Pull band apart and back in wide arc.

commonMistakes.mistake: Shrugging instead of rear delt focus.

exercise.name: Resistance Band Pull Apart
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens rear delts, rhomboids, and middle traps for better posture.

executionSteps.step: Hold band at chest height, arms extended.
Pull band apart by squeezing shoulder blades.
Bring hands wide at face level.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using too strong band limiting range.
Pulling with arms instead of scapulae.

exercise.name: Single Arm Upright Row | Gymstick
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral upright row with resistance bar to correct imbalances in traps and delts.

executionSteps.step: Hold Gymstick in one hand, step on band.
Pull handle upward to chin, elbow high.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using wrist instead of elbow drive.

exercise.name: Face Pull With Resistance Band
exercise.whatItDoes: Band face pull for rear delts, middle traps, and rotator cuff health.

executionSteps.step: Grip ends, pull toward face with elbows high.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling to chest instead of face.

exercise.name: One Arm Medicine Ball Slam
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops explosive shoulder power, unilateral stability, and core integration through overhead slamming motion.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width, medicine ball in one hand.
Raise ball overhead with both hands, transfer to one hand at top.
Explosively slam ball to ground using shoulder and core power.
Catch bounce or pick up, repeat, switch sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only arm instead of full-body drive.
Slamming too far forward or backward.

exercise.name: Seated Barbell Shoulder Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Primary compound press building anterior and medial deltoids with supported seated position.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench with back support, barbell at collarbone.
Press bar overhead until arms locked.
Lower slowly to chin/upper chest level.

exercise.name: Medicine Ball Overhead Throw
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive overhead throw developing shoulder power and full-body coordination.

executionSteps.step: Hold medicine ball at chest, squat slightly.
Explosively extend hips and press ball overhead.
Throw ball forward or upward maximally.

commonMistakes.mistake: Throwing with arms only, no leg drive.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Push Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive press using leg drive to overload deltoids and build power.

executionSteps.step: Drive explosively upward while pressing dumbbells overhead.
Lock arms at top, lower to shoulders.

commonMistakes.mistake: Turning into jerk with second dip.

exercise.name: Standing Dumbbell Shoulder Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Fundamental overhead press building all three deltoid heads and core stability.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding dumbbells at shoulder height.
Press dumbbells overhead until arms locked.
Keep core tight, no excessive lean.

exercise.name: Arm Scissors
exercise.whatItDoes: Dynamic warm-up increasing blood flow and endurance in deltoids.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall, arms extended to sides at shoulder height.
Cross arms in front like scissors.

exercise.name: Side Arm Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Bodyweight lateral raise variation improving medial deltoid endurance.

executionSteps.step: Raise arms laterally to shoulder height.

exercise.name: Arm Circles
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves shoulder mobility and endurance through circular motion.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall, arms extended to sides.
Make small to large forward circles.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates medial deltoids for shoulder width and cap development.

executionSteps.step: Raise arms laterally to shoulder height, slight bend in elbows.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Compound press targeting all deltoid heads with unilateral stability.

executionSteps.step: Sit or stand, dumbbells at shoulders.
Keep neutral grip or rotate palms forward.

exercise.name: Smith Machine Behind Neck Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets deltoids with behind-neck variation (use caution for shoulder health).

executionSteps.step: Sit in Smith machine, bar behind head.
Unrack and lower bar behind neck to ear level.

exercise.name: Smith Machine Shoulder Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Fixed-path overhead press for heavy loading with stability.

executionSteps.step: Sit or stand in Smith machine, bar at collarbone.
Unrack and press upward to lockout.

exercise.name: Cable Lateral Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Constant tension lateral raise for enhanced medial deltoid isolation.

executionSteps.step: Stand sideways to low cable, grip handle.
Raise arm laterally to shoulder height.

exercise.name: 45 Degree Incline Row
exercise.whatItDoes: Supported row targeting rear delts and upper back in prone position.

exercise.name: Lever Shoulder Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Machine-based overhead press for controlled deltoid loading.

executionSteps.step: Sit in lever shoulder press machine.

exercise.name: Standing Close Grip Military Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Close-grip overhead press emphasizing anterior deltoids and upper chest while building shoulder strength.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding barbell with narrow grip (shoulder-width or closer).
Press bar overhead from collarbone to lockout.
Keep core braced, no leg drive.

commonMistakes.mistake: Flaring elbows too wide despite close grip.
Partial range at top or bottom.

exercise.name: Barbell Military Press (Overhead press)
exercise.whatItDoes: Classic standing overhead press building overall shoulder mass and core stability.

executionSteps.step: Stand with barbell at collarbone, shoulder-width grip.
Press bar straight overhead to lockout.
Keep heels together or slightly apart, core tight.
Lower bar to upper chest controlled.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pressing bar in front of head.
Using leg drive (turning into push press).

exercise.name: Dumbbell Chest Supported Lateral Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Supported lateral raise isolating medial deltoids with no momentum.

executionSteps.step: Lie chest down on incline bench.

exercise.name: Dumbbell 6 Way Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Comprehensive shoulder complex hitting all deltoid heads and rotator cuff in one sequence.

executionSteps.step: Perform front raise, lateral raise, 45 raise, rear raise, and variations in sequence.
Use light weight for high reps.

exercise.name: Dumbbell 4 Way Lateral Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Multi-angle lateral raise series targeting all portions of medial and rear delts.

executionSteps.step: Perform lateral raises at different angles (straight side, front, rear, 45).

exercise.name: Alternating Dumbbell Front Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral front raise targeting anterior deltoids with balanced development.

executionSteps.step: Raise one arm forward to shoulder height.
Lower slowly while raising opposite arm.

exercise.name: Two Arm Cable Front Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Constant tension front raise for anterior deltoid isolation.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing away from low cables, grip handles.
Raise both arms forward to shoulder height.

exercise.name: Two Arm Dumbbell Front Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Bilateral front raise targeting anterior deltoids.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding dumbbells in front of thighs.
Raise both arms forward to shoulder height.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates anterior deltoids for front shoulder development.

executionSteps.step: Raise one or both arms forward to eye level.

exercise.name: Cable Front Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral cable front raise with constant tension on anterior delts.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing away from low cable.
Raise arm forward to shoulder height.

exercise.name: Leaning Single Arm Dumbbell Lateral Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases range of motion and stretch on medial deltoids with leaning position.

executionSteps.step: Lean away holding support with one hand, dumbbell in other.
Raise arm laterally from stretched position.
Lift to parallel or slightly above.

exercise.name: Seated Behind Neck Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Behind-neck press variation (use with caution) targeting deltoids.

executionSteps.step: Sit with barbell behind neck on traps.
Lower behind head to ear level.

commonMistakes.mistake: Poor shoulder mobility forcing bad form.

exercise.name: Rear Delt Fly Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates posterior deltoids with machine support.

executionSteps.step: Sit facing into rear delt machine.
Pull arms back in wide arc.

exercise.name: Seated Rear Lateral Dumbbell Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Seated bent-over raise isolating rear deltoids with reduced cheating.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench edge, bend forward.

exercise.name: Half Arnold Press
exercise.whatItDoes: Partial-range Arnold press focusing on rotation and front/medial delts.

executionSteps.step: Start with dumbbells at shoulders, palms facing you.
Press upward while rotating palms forward halfway.
Stop at mid-range if half version.
