exercise.whatItDoes: Explosive throw engaging triceps power.

executionSteps.step: Lie supine, hold ball at chest.

exercise.name: Reverse Dips
exercise.whatItDoes: Bench dip for triceps.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench, hands beside hips.

exercise.name: Planche Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Extreme push-up in planche lean loading triceps.

exercise.name: Archer Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral emphasis push-up heavily loading one tricep at a time.

executionSteps.step: Lower to one side, opposite arm straight.

exercise.name: Ring Dips
exercise.whatItDoes: Unstable dip for triceps and stabilizer muscles.

exercise.name: Single Arm Raise Push-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Plyometric push-up raising one arm at top.

executionSteps.step: Raise one arm overhead at top.

exercise.name: Suspended Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Unstable suspension push-up for triceps and core.

exercise.name: Close-grip Dumbbell Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Close grip on dumbbells for deeper triceps range.

exercise.name: Medicine Ball Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: Unstable push-up on ball for triceps.

exercise.name: Single Arm Push-Up on Medicine Ball
exercise.whatItDoes: Unilateral unstable push-up for extreme triceps strength.

exercise.name: Rear Drive With Resistance Band
exercise.whatItDoes: Band kickback variation.

exercise.name: Standing Triceps Extension | Gymstick
exercise.whatItDoes: Overhead extension with resistance bar.

exercise.name: Banded Overhead Triceps Extension
exercise.whatItDoes: Band overhead extension.

exercise.name: Overhead Triceps Extension | Gymstick
exercise.whatItDoes: Overhead extension with resistance bar.

exercise.name: Seated Zottman Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the biceps during the upward phase and heavily emphasizes the forearms (brachioradialis and extensors) during the lowering phase, promoting balanced arm development.

executionSteps.step: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, palms facing forward.
Curl the dumbbells up toward your shoulders while keeping elbows close to your sides.
At the top, rotate your wrists so palms face down (pronated grip).
Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with palms facing down.
Rotate wrists back to palms forward at the bottom and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum or swinging the weights to lift them.
Allowing elbows to flare out or move forward/backward.
Not fully rotating the wrists at the top for maximum forearm engagement.

exercise.name: Wrist Roller
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds exceptional grip strength and forearm size by working both flexor and extensor muscles through full range of motion.

executionSteps.step: Hold the wrist roller with both hands at shoulder width, arms extended straight in front.
Roll the weight up by rotating your wrists forward (one hand over the other) until the weight reaches the top.
Slowly lower the weight by reversing the wrist rotation.
Repeat for the desired reps, then switch direction if needed.

commonMistakes.mistake: Bending the arms or using shoulders to assist the movement.
Using too heavy a weight that compromises form.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Seated Neutral Wrist Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the forearm flexors with a neutral grip, helping build balanced forearm development and grip strength.

executionSteps.step: Sit on a bench, holding a dumbbell with neutral grip (palm facing in), forearm resting on thigh, wrist just beyond knee.
Lower the dumbbell as far as possible by bending the wrist downward.
Curl the wrist upward, lifting the dumbbell as high as possible.
Squeeze at the top, then slowly lower and repeat.
Switch arms after completing the set.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum or lifting the forearm off the thigh.
Going too heavy and sacrificing full range of motion.
Rushing the reps without controlled movement.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Primarily targets the wrist flexors on the underside of the forearms to increase size and grip strength.

executionSteps.step: Sit on a bench with forearms resting on thighs, palms up, holding dumbbells with wrists just beyond knees.
Lower the dumbbells by extending wrists downward as far as possible.
Curl wrists upward, raising the dumbbells as high as possible.
Squeeze at the top and slowly lower for the next rep.

commonMistakes.mistake: Lifting forearms off thighs during the movement.
Using excessive weight leading to swinging.
Not achieving full range of motion at bottom or top.

exercise.name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the wrist extensors on the top of the forearms, balancing flexor development and improving grip stability.

executionSteps.step: Sit on a bench with forearms on thighs, palms down, holding a barbell with wrists beyond knees.
Lower the barbell by extending wrists downward.
Lift the barbell by flexing wrists upward as high as possible.
Squeeze at the top and control the descent.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using shoulders or rocking the torso to assist.
Limited range of motion due to tight wrists.

exercise.name: Wrist Circles Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves wrist mobility, reduces stiffness, and enhances circulation in the wrist joints and forearms.

executionSteps.step: Extend arms straight in front or clasp hands together.
Rotate wrists in large circles clockwise for 10-15 repetitions.
Reverse direction and rotate counterclockwise for another 10-15 reps.

commonMistakes.mistake: Making small circles instead of full range.

exercise.name: Barbell Reverse Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Primarily targets the brachioradialis in the forearms while also engaging the biceps and brachialis for overall arm thickness.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding a barbell with pronated (palms down) grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep elbows tucked and curl the bar up toward chest.
Squeeze at the top, then slowly lower under control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum or swinging the bar.
Gripping too wide or too narrow.

exercise.name: Cable One-Arm Wrist Curl On Floor
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides constant tension to the forearm flexors for enhanced muscle activation and growth.

executionSteps.step: Kneel or sit facing low cable pulley, grasp handle with one hand palm up.
Rest forearm on floor or thigh, wrist extended beyond edge.
Curl wrist upward against cable resistance.
Slowly lower back to start and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using body weight to assist the curl.

exercise.name: Hand Gripper
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens crushing grip and forearm muscles responsible for finger flexion.

executionSteps.step: Hold the gripper in one hand.
Squeeze handles together as hard as possible.
Hold contraction for 1-2 seconds or perform reps.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only partial range if gripper is too heavy.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Reverse Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Emphasizes the brachioradialis and forearm extensors while also working the biceps for balanced upper arm development.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding dumbbells at sides, palms facing in, then rotate to palms down.
Curl dumbbells up while keeping elbows fixed.
Squeeze at top and lower slowly.

exercise.name: Seated Hammer Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the brachialis and brachioradialis for added arm thickness and forearm development.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench holding dumbbells at sides, palms facing in (neutral grip).
Curl dumbbells up toward shoulders without rotating wrists.
Squeeze at top and lower slowly.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rotating wrists (turning it into regular curl).

exercise.name: Reverse Grip EZ-Bar Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Stresses the brachioradialis and extensors for forearm growth while reducing wrist strain compared to straight bar.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding EZ-bar with reverse (pronated) grip on angled handles.
Curl bar up to chest level, keeping elbows fixed.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Scott Hammer Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the brachialis and forearms with neutral grip on preacher bench to prevent cheating.

executionSteps.step: Sit at preacher bench, arm extended over pad holding dumbbell neutral grip.
Squeeze at top and lower slowly.

exercise.name: Behind The Back Barbell Wrist Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Intensely targets forearm flexors with a unique angle that increases range of motion.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding barbell behind back, palms facing backward.
Curl wrists upward to lift bar.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using shoulders to shrug bar up.
Limited range due to poor mobility.

exercise.name: Standing One Arm Chest Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches the pectoral muscles and anterior shoulder, improving posture and shoulder mobility.

executionSteps.step: Stand and bring one arm behind you at shoulder height against a wall or door frame.
Gently turn body away from arm to deepen stretch in chest.
Hold for 20-30 seconds while breathing deeply.

commonMistakes.mistake: Over-rotating or forcing the stretch painfully.

exercise.name: Wrist Ulnar Deviator And Extensor Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches the ulnar deviators and wrist extensors to improve flexibility and reduce tension on the top/outer forearm.

executionSteps.step: Extend one arm forward, palm down.
Use opposite hand to gently pull fingers toward the little finger side while extending wrist back.

commonMistakes.mistake: Applying too much pressure causing pain.

exercise.name: Reverse Wrist Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches the wrist extensors on the top of the forearm to relieve tension and improve flexibility.

executionSteps.step: Extend arm forward, palm facing down.
Use opposite hand to gently pull fingers back toward forearm.
Hold for 20-30 seconds with steady breath.

commonMistakes.mistake: Holding breath instead of breathing deeply.

exercise.name: Wrist Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches the wrist flexors on the underside of the forearm to improve range of motion and reduce tightness.

executionSteps.step: Use opposite hand to gently pull fingers back toward forearm.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Preacher Hammer (Scott) Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the brachialis and brachioradialis with strict form on the preacher bench for maximum arm thickness.

executionSteps.step: Sit at preacher bench, rest arm on pad holding dumbbell neutral grip.

commonMistakes.mistake: Lifting arm off pad to cheat.
Partial reps at top or bottom.

exercise.name: Weighted Neutral Wrist Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the forearm flexors with a neutral wrist position for balanced development and improved grip strength.

executionSteps.step: Sit with forearm resting on thigh or bench, palm facing in (neutral grip), holding a dumbbell with wrist extended beyond edge.
Lower the weight by extending the wrist downward.
Curl the wrist upward as far as possible.
Squeeze at the top and slowly lower.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

exercise.name: Single Dumbbell Spider Hammer Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the brachialis and brachioradialis in a prone position for peak contraction and forearm emphasis with neutral grip.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down on an incline bench, arm hanging with dumbbell in neutral grip.
Curl the dumbbell up toward shoulder without rotating wrist.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum or swinging the weight.
Rotating the wrist during the curl.
Not fully extending at the bottom.

exercise.name: Reverse Wrist Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the wrist extensors on the top of the forearms to balance development and enhance grip stability.

executionSteps.step: Sit with forearms on thighs, palms down, holding dumbbells with wrists beyond knees.
Lower weights by extending wrists downward.
Squeeze at top and lower controlled.

commonMistakes.mistake: Too heavy weight causing form breakdown.

exercise.name: Wrist Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Primarily targets the forearm flexors to build size and improve crushing grip strength.

executionSteps.step: Sit with forearms on thighs, palms up, holding barbell with wrists beyond knees.
Lower bar by extending wrists down.
Curl wrists up as high as possible.

exercise.name: Hammer Curl with Resistance Band
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the brachialis and brachioradialis with constant band tension for enhanced forearm and arm thickness.

executionSteps.step: Stand on resistance band with feet shoulder-width, holding ends with neutral grip.
Curl hands toward shoulders without rotating wrists.
Lower slowly resisting the band pull.

exercise.name: Cable Reverse Grip EZ-bar Biceps Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides constant tension to the brachioradialis and extensors for superior forearm development with reduced wrist stress.

executionSteps.step: Attach EZ-bar to low cable pulley, grip pronated on angled handles.
Stand and curl bar toward chest keeping elbows fixed.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using hips to swing the bar.

exercise.name: Barbell Finger Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens finger flexors and improves crushing grip by rolling the barbell with fingers.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding barbell with palms up, fingers wrapped around.
Release fingers to let bar roll down to fingertips.
Roll bar back up by curling fingers and wrist.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using wrist only without finger involvement.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Finger Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances finger strength and grip by isolating finger flexion with dumbbells.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbell in one hand, palm up.
Release grip to let dumbbell roll to fingertips.
Curl fingers to roll dumbbell back into palm.
Squeeze and repeat, then switch hands.

exercise.name: Single Arm Reverse Grip Cable Bicep Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the brachioradialis with constant cable tension for unilateral forearm and arm development.

executionSteps.step: Attach single handle to low cable, grip pronated.
Stand and curl handle toward shoulder keeping elbow fixed.

exercise.name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl Over a Bench
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates wrist extensors with supported forearms for focused forearm top development.

executionSteps.step: Kneel beside bench, rest forearms on bench palms down holding barbell.

exercise.name: Water Bottle Hammer Curl
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides a home alternative to target brachialis and forearms with neutral grip using filled water bottles as weights.

executionSteps.step: Hold filled water bottles at sides with neutral grip (palms facing in).
Curl bottles up toward shoulders without rotating wrists.

exercise.name: One Arm Medicine Ball Slam
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops explosive core power, unilateral strength, and anti-rotational stability while targeting the entire abdominal region.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball in one hand.
Raise the ball overhead with both hands or single arm, engaging the core.
Forcefully slam the ball into the ground while pivoting slightly.
Pick up the ball and repeat on the same side or alternate.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using arms only without core engagement.
Not squatting or using legs for power.

exercise.name: Medicine Ball Rotational Throw
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds rotational power and strength in the obliques and core for improved athletic performance and torso stability.

executionSteps.step: Stand sideways to a wall, feet shoulder-width, holding medicine ball at hip level.
Rotate torso away from wall, loading hips.
Explosively rotate and throw the ball against the wall.
Catch the rebound and repeat, then switch sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using arms only without hip rotation.

exercise.name: Dragon Flag
exercise.whatItDoes: One of the most advanced bodyweight core exercises, intensely targeting the entire abdominal wall and hip flexors.

executionSteps.step: Lie on a bench, grip behind head for support.
Lift body into straight line, supported only by upper back.
Slowly lower body without bending until almost parallel to ground.
Raise back up using core strength.

exercise.name: Ab Coaster Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the rectus abdominis and obliques with guided motion for focused abdominal contraction.

executionSteps.step: Sit or kneel on the machine, grip handles, place arms on pads.
Lift knees toward chest by crunching abs.

exercise.name: Cross Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the obliques and rectus abdominis through rotational movement for improved core definition.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hands behind head, knees bent.
Lift shoulder blade and rotate to bring opposite elbow to knee.

exercise.name: Standing Cable Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the rectus abdominis with constant tension for enhanced upper and mid ab development.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing away from high cable pulley, grip rope behind head.
Crunch forward bringing elbows toward thighs.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling with arms instead of abs.

exercise.name: Seated Bench Leg Pull-in
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the lower abs and hip flexors while seated for controlled contraction.

executionSteps.step: Sit on edge of bench, lean back slightly, hands gripping sides.
Pull knees toward chest using abs.

exercise.name: Cross Body Mountain Climber
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases heart rate while targeting obliques and entire core through rotational pulling motion.

executionSteps.step: Bring one knee across body toward opposite elbow.
Alternate sides quickly while keeping hips low.

exercise.name: Alternate Leg Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Focuses on lower abs and hip flexors with alternating motion for balanced development.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hands under hips or sides.
Lift one leg straight up while keeping other on ground.

exercise.name: Crunches
exercise.whatItDoes: Classic exercise targeting the upper rectus abdominis for core strengthening.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, knees bent, hands behind head.
Lift shoulders off ground by contracting abs.

exercise.name: Mountain Climber
exercise.whatItDoes: Dynamic full-core exercise that elevates heart rate and improves cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Keep core tight and hips low.

exercise.name: Bicycle Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Highly effective for obliques and rectus abdominis through combined crunch and twist.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hands behind head, legs lifted.
Bring opposite elbow to knee while extending other leg.

exercise.name: Lying Scissor Kick
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets lower abs and hip flexors with scissoring motion for endurance.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hands under hips, legs extended.
Lift both legs slightly off ground.
Cross legs over each other alternately.

exercise.name: Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Primarily targets lower abs and hip flexors for stronger core control.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hands under hips.
Lift straight legs up to vertical.

exercise.name: Oblique Floor Crunches
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the obliques for side abdominal definition and rotational strength.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat.
Crunch up and twist to one side.

exercise.name: T-Cross Sit-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines sit-up with cross rotation to target obliques and upper abs.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, arms extended to sides forming T.
Sit up and reach one hand to opposite foot.

exercise.name: Dead Bug
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves core stability and coordination while preventing lower back strain.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, arms and knees up.
Extend opposite arm and leg while keeping back flat.

exercise.name: Decline Sit-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases resistance on upper abs and hip flexors due to decline angle.

executionSteps.step: Secure feet on decline bench, lie back.

exercise.name: Reverse Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Focuses on lower abs by lifting hips off ground.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, knees bent, hands at sides.
Lift hips by pulling knees toward chest.

exercise.name: Kneeling Cable Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides weighted resistance to upper abs with kneeling position.

executionSteps.step: Kneel facing high cable, grip rope behind head.
Crunch down bringing elbows to knees.

exercise.name: Heel Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets obliques with side-to-side reaching motion.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat.
Crunch up slightly and reach to touch one heel.

exercise.name: Standing Rotation
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves rotational mobility and oblique activation in standing position.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall, hands behind head or holding weight.

exercise.name: Standing Toe Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches hamstrings and lower back while engaging core for balance.

executionSteps.step: Bend at hips to reach toward toes.

exercise.name: Crunch With Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines upper and lower ab activation in one movement.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, legs raised vertical.
Crunch up while keeping legs up.

exercise.name: Alternate Lying Floor Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Alternating leg lifts for lower ab focus and stability.

executionSteps.step: Raise one leg while other stays down.

exercise.name: Weighted Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Adds resistance to standard crunch for progressive overload on upper abs.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hold weight on chest or overhead.

exercise.name: Seated Side Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets obliques while seated for accessible side core work.

executionSteps.step: Sit tall on chair or bench.
Lean to one side crunching oblique.

exercise.name: Incline Leg Hip Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced lower ab exercise using incline for greater resistance.

executionSteps.step: Lie on incline bench, grip top.
Lift legs and hips off bench.

exercise.name: Bodyweight Windmill
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances oblique flexibility, core stability, and shoulder mobility.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet wide, arms extended sideways.
Bend and reach one hand to opposite foot.

exercise.name: Front to Side Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds core stability, strengthens obliques, and improves anti-rotational control by transitioning between front and side plank.

executionSteps.step: Start in forearm front plank position.
Rotate body to one side into forearm side plank, stacking or staggering feet.
Hold briefly, then rotate back to front plank.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not stacking hips properly in side plank.

exercise.name: Tuck Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets upper and lower abs simultaneously by combining crunch with knee tuck.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hands behind head or at sides.
Lift shoulders and knees off ground.
Crunch forward while pulling knees toward chest.
Extend back to start without touching ground.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Side Bend
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the obliques for lateral core strength and thickness.

executionSteps.step: Stand holding dumbbell in one hand, other hand on hip or head.
Contract opposite oblique to return upright.

exercise.name: Double Leg Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Pilates movement that challenges core stability while stretching and strengthening the entire abdominal wall.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, knees tucked to chest, hands on shins.
Extend arms overhead and legs forward simultaneously.
Circle arms and pull knees back in.

exercise.name: Spider Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Dynamic plank variation targeting obliques and hip flexors.

executionSteps.step: Bring one knee toward same-side elbow outside arm.
Return to plank and alternate sides.

exercise.name: Captains Chair Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Excellent for lower abs and hip flexors with supported vertical position.

executionSteps.step: Step into captain's chair, grip handles, back against pad.
Lift knees or straight legs toward chest.

exercise.name: Bench Side Bend
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets obliques with extended range on bench for deeper stretch and contraction.

executionSteps.step: Sit sideways on bench, one foot hooked under pad.

exercise.name: Crab Twist Toe Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines crab position with rotational reach to target obliques and improve coordination.

executionSteps.step: Sit in crab position, hips lifted.
Lift one hand and reach across to touch opposite toe.

exercise.name: Quarter Sit-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Beginner-friendly movement focusing on upper abs with limited range.

executionSteps.step: Lift shoulders only a quarter way up.

exercise.name: Weighted Sit-ups
exercise.whatItDoes: Adds resistance to traditional sit-up for greater abdominal overload.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hold weight on chest or overhead.

exercise.name: Lying Knee Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets lower abs by lifting bent knees toward chest.

executionSteps.step: Bend knees and pull toward chest.

exercise.name: Floor Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Fundamental upper ab exercise performed on the floor.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, knees bent, hands behind head.

exercise.name: Reverse Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens posterior core, glutes, and shoulders in reverse position.

executionSteps.step: Sit with legs extended, hands behind hips.

exercise.name: Stability Ball Knee Tuck
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced movement targeting entire core with instability challenge.

executionSteps.step: Start in plank with shins on stability ball.
Pull knees toward chest, rolling ball forward.

exercise.name: Hanging Knee Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets lower abs with hanging position for greater range.

executionSteps.step: Hang from bar with overhand grip.

exercise.name: Hanging Side Knee Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets obliques intensely with lateral knee drive.

executionSteps.step: Lift knees diagonally toward one shoulder.

exercise.name: Hanging Windshield Wiper
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced oblique exercise with rotational control in hanging position.

executionSteps.step: Hang with legs raised to L-sit or knees up.
Rotate legs side to side like wipers.

exercise.name: Toes to Bar
exercise.whatItDoes: Highly advanced lower ab and grip exercise requiring full straight-leg lift.

executionSteps.step: Lift straight legs until toes touch bar.

exercise.name: Weighted Hanging Knee Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases resistance on lower abs with added weight between feet.

executionSteps.step: Hang from bar holding dumbbell between feet.

exercise.name: Teaser Pilates
exercise.whatItDoes: Classic Pilates move for full core control and balance.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, arms overhead, legs extended.
Roll up into V-shape, arms parallel to legs.

exercise.name: Seated Oblique Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets obliques while seated for accessible rotational work.

executionSteps.step: Sit with knees bent, lean back slightly.

exercise.name: Side Bridge
exercise.whatItDoes: Isometric hold targeting obliques and lateral core stability.

executionSteps.step: Lie on side, forearm on ground.

exercise.name: Plank With Arm And Leg Lift
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases core stability challenge by reducing base of support.

executionSteps.step: Lift opposite arm and leg simultaneously.

exercise.name: Weighted Front Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Progresses standard plank with added weight for greater core demand.

executionSteps.step: Have partner place weight plate on upper back.

exercise.name: Cable Side Bend
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides constant tension on obliques during lateral flexion.

executionSteps.step: Stand sideways to low cable, grip handle.

exercise.name: Barbell Side Bend
exercise.whatItDoes: Heavy oblique loading with barbell across shoulders.

exercise.name: Seated Barbell Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Weighted rotational exercise targeting obliques while seated.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bench, barbell across shoulders.

exercise.name: Bent Over Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Rotational core work in bent-over position for obliques and spinal mobility.

executionSteps.step: Stand bent at hips, arms crossed or extended.

exercise.name: Dumbbell V-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Weighted full-core movement combining upper and lower ab contraction.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back holding dumbbell overhead.
Lift torso and legs into V-shape.

exercise.name: Lever Lying Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Machine-based crunch with adjustable resistance for upper abs.

exercise.name: Twisting Hyperextension
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets obliques and lower back with rotational extension.

executionSteps.step: Lower torso, then lift with twist.

exercise.name: Ab Roller Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Intense full-core exercise with extended range using ab wheel.

exercise.name: Standing Cable High-To-Low Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Anti-rotational oblique work with high-to-low chopping motion.

executionSteps.step: Pull handle down and across body.

exercise.name: Standing Cable Low-To-High Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Oblique-focused woodchop variation from low to high.

executionSteps.step: Pull handle up and across body.

exercise.name: Standing Cable Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Rotational core strength with constant cable tension.

exercise.name: L-Sit
exercise.whatItDoes: Advanced isometric hold requiring extreme core and hip flexor strength.

executionSteps.step: Lift body and legs into L-shape.
Hold with legs parallel to ground.

exercise.name: High Knee Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines squat with high knee drive for core, legs, and cardio.

executionSteps.step: Explode up driving one knee high.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Windmill
exercise.whatItDoes: Challenges oblique stability, shoulder mobility, and hamstring flexibility.

executionSteps.step: Hinge at hips and bend sideways toward floor.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Swings
exercise.whatItDoes: Full-body explosive movement heavily engaging core for power transfer.

executionSteps.step: Squeeze core and glutes at top.

exercise.name: Full Crunch Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Machine-guided full-range crunch for controlled abdominal loading.

executionSteps.step: Sit in crunch machine, adjust weight.

exercise.name: Front Plank with Arm Lift
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances core stability, balance, and shoulder strength by adding unilateral arm lift to the standard plank.

executionSteps.step: Start in forearm plank position with elbows under shoulders.
Engage core and lift one arm straight forward.
Hold for a few seconds while maintaining stability.
Lower arm and repeat on the other side.

exercise.name: Bhujangasana | Cobra Abdominal Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Stretches the abdominal muscles, strengthens the back, and improves spinal flexibility.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down with hands under shoulders.
Press into palms to lift chest off ground, keeping hips down.
Lengthen spine and gaze forward or slightly up.
Hold for 20-30 seconds while breathing deeply.

exercise.name: Ab Straps Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Intensely targets lower abs and hip flexors in hanging position.

executionSteps.step: Hang from ab straps with elbows secured.
Lift knees or straight legs toward chest.

exercise.name: Boat Pose
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens core, hip flexors, and improves balance in V-sit position.

executionSteps.step: Sit with knees bent, lean back slightly.
